Living in Richmond

Richmond Apartments for Rent

Richmond has an average Walk Score of 51 with 204,214 residents.

Richmond is somewhat bikeable.

The most walkable Richmond neighborhoods are Monroe Ward, Jackson Ward and Carytown.

Some errands can be accomplished on foot.

Eating & Drinking

There are about 836 restaurants, bars and coffee shops in Richmond.

People in Richmond can walk to an average of 3 restaurants, bars and coffee shops in 5 minutes.

I'm a picture taker, a daydreamer, a memory keeper, a travel junkie, a storyteller, a fan of grilled cheese sandwiches and I have a wandering heart & soul. I currently live in Richmond, Va in an old and quirky part of town .

Shockoe Bottom

Bacchus

Fountain Lake

Virginia Museum of Fine Arts

Confederate Memorial Chapel

Museum District

Shockoe Bottom runs along side of the James River and the Kanawha Canal which means that it also runs along side of the flood wall creating some interesting architectural elements.

Phoebe Reid
on Shockoe Bottom

Shockoe Bottom

Main Street Station

Shockoe Bottom

Great Shiplock Park

The Virginia Capital Trail is a 55-mile long, dedicated multi-use trail connecting Richmond and Williamsburg along the historic and beautiful Rt. 5 corridor. Part of it runs through Shockoe Bottom and provides a perfect spot for walking, biking, running and/or jogging.

Phoebe Reid
on Shockoe Bottom

Richmond is Talking About...

rva movie eating coffee tired food god class song money school walk job sleep vcu car dinner party drinking playing

Richmond is all about:

Tweet @WalkScore

Great Shiplock Park

Shockoe Bottom

This iconic place is the centerpiece of the Museum District. The VMFA, Virginia Museum of Fine Arts, was recently completely refurbished and expanded, was one of just a handful of museums worldwide to host Picasso: Masterpieces from the Muse National Picasso, Paris in 2011, always has free general admission and offers a variety of classes for children and adults. In addition the museum has a cafe and a restaurant on site and park like grounds with outdoor sculptures and benches.

Phoebe Reid
on Virginia Museum of Fine Arts
